page.title: 10PORTHMADOG HOUSING
page.content: Few houses in the area pre-date the construction of the Cob(1811).In the town are terraced streets of stone- built houses all with slate roofs.In the villages new estates have sprung up,some being bungalows with open-plan gardens and others with semi-detached and detached houses.These houses and bungalows are privately owned,many of them being holiday homes for people out of the area.All of the houses in the area have slate roofs.What other material could be used in the once slate-exporting capital of the world? There are also some council estates that have been built in the town.Some of the houses there are privately owned and some council owned.The urban decay usually associated with old property has been averted by modernisation encouraged by council grants.
